channel.title: Monster Beats Tour
channel.description:
So anyways, I need your help. My friend is selling copies of these for $40, and apparently he bought them online, but he wont tell us what site. The only difference between these ones is the box, and they use plastic in a few places instead of the chrome. I have listened to them, and they sound just as good as the real ones. So my question is, can anyone help me find these? I'm thinking they're costing somewhere from $20-$30 a pair, considering he's selling them for $40. Thanks guys.
Edit: I think I found them :D http://www.deal-cool.com/Product/Designers-MT-Dr-Dre-In-Ear-Tour-Headphones.htm $14 a pair :D
Since I didn't post this in questions, I will turn it into a discussion also: Discuss how outrageous you think the $190 price tag on them is.

item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

m.dog311:

The ones I tried did. I’m going to order a pair here in a bit, and I’ll tell you if they actually are.

Thanks <3

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Only time I have ever spent more than $15 on headphones was ones for my phone. Bluetooth, had a answer, VUp, VDown, next, previous, pause/play buttons. Made it perfect for riding around on my motorcycle as the need to not take my phone outta pocket while going 70+ down the highway was decreased lmfao. (Its actually not as hard as it sounds tho.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I’ve never actually bought a pair of Apple headphones, I’ve only ever used the ones that came with my iPod. They’re pretty good. And yea, these Sony ones aren’t that great. They tend to be really quiet, and I usually get a good bit of static in them.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

anything > sony.

though, I tend to use the apple headphones, always have worked perfectly fine for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I have a pair of ear buds right now that cost me $25 (they’re Sony), and quite honestly, these $14 fake beats blow the Sony ones away. So I think I might actually buy a couple pairs of these fake ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Just like puma shoes, 130$ for a decent pair of running shoes. It’s insane. Like lets face it. If it were normal running shoes without the brand name, I give it meh 20 - 30$ for the shoes. It’s the name which makes it so expensive.

But a decent set of head phones they are. I’d pay max 50$ too.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Beats Tour
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I mean ya, they’re extremely nice headphones, but they’re definitely not worth $190. I honestly wouldn’t pay more than $50 for them. Most of what that $190 is paying for is the name though.

Read full topic
